actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights

official_title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to provide for a four-year term of office for Representatives in Congress, and to require that any Representative who officially declares his candidacy for election to the Senate immediately vacate his seat.

summary.text: Constitutional Amendment - Provides for a four-year term of office for Members of the House of Representatives. Requires Representatives who declare candidacy for election to the Senate to vacate their seats in the House at the time of such declaration.

titles.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to provide for a four-year term of office for Representatives in Congress, and to require that any Representative who officially declares his candidacy for election to the Senate immediately vacate his seat.
